country: Angola, Democratic Republic of the Congo
life_date: Angola or Democratic Republic of the Congo
medium: Wood, vegetable fiber, glass beads, metal
text: Known as pwo (woman) or mwana pwo (young woman), this type of mask is worn by men whose outfits include breasts carved in wood and fastened to their netted costume. The masks evoke female ancestors, who are responsible for guarding the community’s fertility. They are represented as beautiful women with balanced features, filed teeth, and delicate scarifications on their cheeks and forehead. This example includes an elaborate hairstyle, consisting of hundreds of strands and knots, embellished with red camwood powder.
title: Mask
